options.content:
Auto Scaling Dashboard

COAST is a collection of customizable Amazon Managed Grafana dashboards, offering both a high-level overview and detailed service-specific insights based on the AWS Cost and Usage Report (CUR). Dashboards cater to executive leadership, FinOps Practitioners, and DevOps/Engineering.

The Auto Scaling Dashboard is designed for specific workloads, leveraging CloudWatch metrics and Cost and Usage Report (CUR) data to present comprehensive visualizations. It includes vital components such as Auto Scaling Groups (ASG), Load Balancers, NAT Gateways, and EC2 Instances that operate within the ASG.

For any inquiries or further assistance in interpreting the data or utilizing the dashboard's features, please contact your assigned Cloud Financial Analyst or FinOps Manager for guidance and support.

How to Utilize this Dashboard
To make the most of the Autoscaling Dashboard, input the following parameters in the top parameter menu:

  1. Region: Select your region (note in the beta version of this dashboard only us-east-1 is supported).
  2. ASG Name: Fill in the name of your Auto Scaling Group (ASG). The name is available on the ASG details page under "Group Details".
  3. Tags: Select the tag key for your resources. The tag values will populate once the tag key is selected. The values for this drop down come from CUR with a lookback period of 3 days.
  4. Load Balancers: This drop down is populated automtically once you select your tag. The values for this drop down come from CUR with a lookback period of 3 days.
  5. Nat Gateways: This drop down is populated automtically once you select your tag. The values for this drop down come from CUR with a lookback period of 3 days.
  6. Granularity: This value is used only in CUR querys to smooth out data based on month, week, day or hour. To match Cloudwatch, select hour.

The Required Columns Validator evaluates your CUR dataset to confirm the presence of essential columns. For the dashboard to operate accurately, the CUR dataset must include columns for:

  • Resource IDs -
    • Resource IDs rows in CUR help deep dive cost at the resource ARNs layer. To setup your CUR with resource IDs see Creating Cost and Usage Report
  • Cost Allocation Tags - Defining a cost allocation tag results in its persistence in your CUR dataset. For our queries to function correctly, it is imperative to have at least one cost allocation tag enabled. See Using Cost Allocation Tags

VERIFIED indicates the presence of the columns in your CUR. FAILED indicates the absence of these columns, and as a result, certain visuals in the dashboard may not function as expected. If this is a new CUR it may take 24 hours for column data to populate.

panels.description: This table will display TRUE if the required savings plans, reservation and cost allocation columns exist within your dataset.

targets.rawSQL:
with user_tag_columns as ( -- count cost allocation tags
SELECT 
COUNT(*) OVER (PARTITION BY column_name) AS user_tag_column_count
FROM information_schema.columns
WHERE 
table_name = '$CurTable'
AND column_name LIKE 'resource_tags_user_%'  
),

resource_columns_query as ( -- check for savings plans column
SELECT 
COUNT(*) OVER (PARTITION BY column_name) AS resource_column_count
FROM information_schema.columns
WHERE 
table_name = '$CurTable'
AND column_name = 'line_item_resource_id'  
)

SELECT 
CASE
    WHEN (SELECT SUM(user_tag_column_count) FROM user_tag_columns) > 0 THEN 'VERIFIED' ELSE 'FAILED' 
END AS cost_allocation_tags,
CASE 
    WHEN (SELECT SUM(resource_column_count) FROM resource_columns_query) > 0 THEN 'VERIFIED' ELSE 'FAILED' 
END AS resource_id_columns

panels.title: CUR Columns Validator

options.content: The period over period analysis tabs will showcase cost for the selected date and time period _N_ , for N-1 period and calculate delta as a percentage.  For example if you today is Friday and you select "Last 2 Days" in the time period the widgets will display Friday and Thursday for the "Selcted Time Period".  Data for Wednesday and Tuesday for the "Prior Time Period" and calculate the percantage change between the two periods.  If you do not have data or tags as far bag as the prior time period, the widget will display a 0.

targets.rawSQL:
-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena
-- To view resource names add in line_item_resource_id to the SELECT and GROUP BY statements
WITH CURRENT_PERIOD_COST AS (
SELECT
date_diff(
  '$Granularity', 
  $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date),  
  $__timeTo(line_item_usage_start_date)
) as HOURS,
SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as period_one_cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date) 
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_operation = 'RunInstances'
  AND line_item_usage_type Like '%Usage%'
GROUP BY
1
LIMIT 1
)
  
SELECT
(SELECT period_one_cost FROM CURRENT_PERIOD_COST) as Cost
FROM 
$CurTable
LIMIT 1

-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena
-- To view resource names add in line_item_resource_id to the SELECT and GROUP BY statements

WITH CURRENT_PERIOD_COST AS (
SELECT
date_diff(
  'hour', 
  $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date),  
  $__timeTo(line_item_usage_start_date)
) as HOURS,
SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as period_one_cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date) 
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
  AND line_item_operation = 'RunInstances'
  AND line_item_usage_type Like '%Usage%'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
GROUP BY
1
LIMIT 1
)
  
SELECT
  SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as Cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE
  line_item_usage_start_date >= $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date) - (SELECT HOURS FROM CURRENT_PERIOD_COST) * INTERVAL '1' HOUR
  AND line_item_usage_start_date <= $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date)
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
  AND line_item_operation = 'RunInstances'
  AND line_item_usage_type Like '%Usage%'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)

-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena
-- To view resource names add in line_item_resource_id to the SELECT and GROUP BY statements
WITH CURRENT_PERIOD_COST AS (
SELECT
date_diff(
  'hour', 
  $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date),  
  $__timeTo(line_item_usage_start_date)
) as HOURS,
SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as period_one_cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date) 
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
  AND line_item_operation = 'RunInstances'
  AND line_item_usage_type Like '%Usage%'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
GROUP BY
1
LIMIT 1
)
  
SELECT
  ((SELECT period_one_cost FROM CURRENT_PERIOD_COST) - SUM(line_item_unblended_cost)) / (SUM(line_item_unblended_cost)) as Change
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE
  line_item_usage_start_date >= $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date) - (SELECT HOURS FROM CURRENT_PERIOD_COST) * INTERVAL '1' HOUR
  AND line_item_usage_start_date <= $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date)
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
  AND line_item_operation = 'RunInstances'
  AND line_item_usage_type Like '%Usage%'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
LIMIT 1;

-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena
-- To view resource names add in line_item_resource_id to the SELECT and GROUP BY statements
WITH CURRENT_PERIOD_COST AS (
SELECT
date_diff(
  '$Granularity', 
  $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date),  
  $__timeTo(line_item_usage_start_date)
) as HOURS,
SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as period_one_cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date) 
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AWSELB'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_usage_type = 'LoadBalancerUsage' 
  AND line_item_operation LIKE '%LoadBalancing%'
GROUP BY
1
LIMIT 1
)
  
SELECT
  (SELECT period_one_cost FROM CURRENT_PERIOD_COST) as Cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
LIMIT 1

WITH CURRENT_PERIOD_COST AS (
SELECT
date_diff(
  'hour', 
  $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date),  
  $__timeTo(line_item_usage_start_date)

SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as period_one_cost

WHERE

  AND line_item_product_code = 'AWSELB'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_usage_type = 'LoadBalancerUsage' 
  AND line_item_operation LIKE '%LoadBalancing%'
GROUP BY
1
LIMIT 1
)
  
SELECT
  SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as Cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE
  line_item_usage_start_date >= $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date) - (SELECT HOURS FROM CURRENT_PERIOD_COST) * INTERVAL '1' HOUR
  AND line_item_usage_start_date <= $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date)
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AWSELB'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_usage_type = 'LoadBalancerUsage' 
  AND line_item_operation LIKE '%LoadBalancing%'

WITH CURRENT_PERIOD_COST AS (
SELECT
date_diff(
  'hour', 
  $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date),  
  $__timeTo(line_item_usage_start_date)
) as HOURS,
SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as period_one_cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date) 
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AWSELB'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_usage_type = 'LoadBalancerUsage' 
  AND line_item_operation LIKE '%LoadBalancing%'
LIMIT 1
)
  
SELECT
  ((SELECT period_one_cost FROM CURRENT_PERIOD_COST) - SUM(line_item_unblended_cost)) / (SUM(line_item_unblended_cost)) as Change
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE
  line_item_usage_start_date >= $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date) - (SELECT HOURS FROM CURRENT_PERIOD_COST) * INTERVAL '1' HOUR
  AND line_item_usage_start_date <= $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date)
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AWSELB'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_usage_type = 'LoadBalancerUsage' 
  AND line_item_operation LIKE '%LoadBalancing%'
LIMIT 1;

panels.title: Load Balancer - Period over Period Analysis

targets.rawSQL:
-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena
-- To view resource names add in line_item_resource_id to the SELECT and GROUP BY statements
WITH CURRENT_PERIOD_COST AS (
SELECT
date_diff(
  '$Granularity', 
  $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date),  
  $__timeTo(line_item_usage_start_date)
) as HOURS,
SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as period_one_cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date) 
  AND (line_item_product_code = 'AWSELB' OR line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2')
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND (line_item_usage_type LIKE '%-Bytes' OR line_item_usage_type = 'LCUUsage' OR line_item_usage_type = 'NLCUUsage')
GROUP BY
1
LIMIT 1
)
  
SELECT
  (SELECT period_one_cost FROM CURRENT_PERIOD_COST) as Cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
LIMIT 1

-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena
-- To view resource names add in line_item_resource_id to the SELECT and GROUP BY statements
WITH CURRENT_PERIOD_COST AS (
SELECT
date_diff(
  'hour', 
  $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date),  
  $__timeTo(line_item_usage_start_date)
) as HOURS,
SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as period_one_cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date) 
  AND (line_item_product_code = 'AWSELB' OR line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2')
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND (line_item_usage_type LIKE '%-Bytes' OR line_item_usage_type = 'LCUUsage' OR line_item_usage_type = 'NLCUUsage')
GROUP BY
1
LIMIT 1
)
  
SELECT
  SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as Cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE
  line_item_usage_start_date >= $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date) - (SELECT HOURS FROM CURRENT_PERIOD_COST) * INTERVAL '1' HOUR
  AND line_item_usage_start_date <= $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date)
  AND (line_item_product_code = 'AWSELB' OR line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2')
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND (line_item_usage_type LIKE '%-Bytes' OR line_item_usage_type = 'LCUUsage' OR line_item_usage_type = 'NLCUUsage')

-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena
-- To view resource names add in line_item_resource_id to the SELECT and GROUP BY statements
WITH CURRENT_PERIOD_COST AS (
SELECT
date_diff(
  'hour', 
  $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date),  
  $__timeTo(line_item_usage_start_date)
) as HOURS,
SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as period_one_cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date) 
  AND (line_item_product_code = 'AWSELB' OR line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2')
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND (line_item_usage_type LIKE '%-Bytes' OR line_item_usage_type = 'LCUUsage' OR line_item_usage_type = 'NLCUUsage')
LIMIT 1
)
  
SELECT
  ((SELECT period_one_cost FROM CURRENT_PERIOD_COST) - SUM(line_item_unblended_cost)) / (SUM(line_item_unblended_cost)) as Change
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE
  line_item_usage_start_date >= $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date) - (SELECT HOURS FROM CURRENT_PERIOD_COST) * INTERVAL '1' HOUR
  AND line_item_usage_start_date <= $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date)
  AND (line_item_product_code = 'AWSELB' OR line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2')
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND (line_item_usage_type LIKE '%-Bytes' OR line_item_usage_type = 'LCUUsage' OR line_item_usage_type = 'NLCUUsage')

-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena
-- To view resource names add in line_item_resource_id to the SELECT and GROUP BY statements
WITH CURRENT_PERIOD_COST AS (
SELECT
date_diff(
  '$Granularity', 
  $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date),  
  $__timeTo(line_item_usage_start_date)
) as HOURS,
SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as period_one_cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date) 
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_usage_type LIKE 'NatGateway-Hours'
  AND line_item_operation = 'NatGateway'
GROUP BY
1
LIMIT 1
)
  
SELECT
  (SELECT period_one_cost FROM CURRENT_PERIOD_COST) as Cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
LIMIT 1

WITH CURRENT_PERIOD_COST AS (
SELECT
date_diff(
  'hour', 
  $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date),  
  $__timeTo(line_item_usage_start_date)
) as HOURS,
SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as period_one_cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date) 
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_usage_type LIKE 'NatGateway-Hours'
  AND line_item_operation = 'NatGateway'
GROUP BY
1
LIMIT 1
)
  
SELECT
  SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as Cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE
  line_item_usage_start_date >= $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date) - (SELECT HOURS FROM CURRENT_PERIOD_COST) * INTERVAL '1' HOUR
  AND line_item_usage_start_date <= $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date)
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_usage_type LIKE 'NatGateway-Hours'
  AND line_item_operation = 'NatGateway'

WITH CURRENT_PERIOD_COST AS (
SELECT
date_diff(
  'hour', 
  $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date),  
  $__timeTo(line_item_usage_start_date)
) as HOURS,
SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as period_one_cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date) 
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_usage_type LIKE 'NatGateway-Hours'
  AND line_item_operation = 'NatGateway'
LIMIT 1
)
  
SELECT
(SELECT period_one_cost FROM CURRENT_PERIOD_COST) / (SUM(line_item_unblended_cost)) - 1 as Change
FROM 
$CurTable
WHERE
line_item_usage_start_date >= $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date) - (SELECT HOURS FROM CURRENT_PERIOD_COST) * INTERVAL '1' HOUR
AND line_item_usage_start_date <= $__timeFrom(line_item_usage_start_date)
AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
AND line_item_usage_type LIKE 'NatGateway-Hours'
AND line_item_operation = 'NatGateway'
LIMIT 1;

panels.title: NAT Gateway - Period over Period Analysis

panels.description:
Compute  Cost - Cost of compute for all instances in ASG
Loadbalance Cost - Cost for Load Balancer and LCUUsage
Networking Cost - Cost for instance traffic, NAT Gateway Traffic and Load Balancer Traffic
Natgateway Cost - Hourly Charge for NAT Gateway

targets.rawSQL:
-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena
-- To view resource names add in line_item_resource_id to the SELECT and GROUP BY statements
SELECT 
  date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
  SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as Cost
FROM
$CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date) 
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_usage_type LIke '%Usage%'
  AND line_item_operation = 'RunInstances'
GROUP BY 
  1
HAVING SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) > 0

-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena
-- To view resource names add in line_item_resource_id to the SELECT and GROUP BY statements
SELECT 
  date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
  SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as Cost
FROM
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date) 
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AWSELB'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_usage_type = 'LoadBalancerUsage' 
  AND line_item_operation LIKE '%LoadBalancing%'
GROUP BY 
  1
HAVING SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) > 0

-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena
-- To view resource names add in line_item_resource_id to the SELECT and GROUP BY statements
SELECT 
date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as Cost
FROM
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date) 
  AND (line_item_product_code = 'AWSELB' OR line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2')
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND (line_item_usage_type LIKE '%-Bytes' OR line_item_usage_type = 'LCUUsage' OR line_item_usage_type = 'NLCUUsage')
GROUP BY 
  1
HAVING SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) > 0

-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena
-- To view resource names add in line_item_resource_id to the SELECT and GROUP BY statements
SELECT 
  date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
  SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as Cost
FROM
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date) 
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_usage_type LIKE 'NatGateway-Hours'
  AND line_item_operation = 'NatGateway'
GROUP BY 
  1
HAVING SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) > 0

panels.title: Service Cost Trends

targets.rawSQL:
-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena
-- To view resource names add in line_item_resource_id to the SELECT and GROUP BY statements
SELECT 
  line_item_availability_zone,
  SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as cost
FROM
  $CurTable
WHERE 
$__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
AND line_item_operation = 'RunInstances'
AND line_item_usage_type Like '%Usage%'
GROUP BY 
1

panels.title: Compute Cost by AZ - Tag: $TagKey Value: $TagValue

  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_operation = 'RunInstances'
  AND line_item_usage_type Like '%Usage%'

1

targets.rawSQL:
-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena 
SELECT

  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)

  AND line_item_operation = 'RunInstances'
  AND line_item_usage_type Like '%Usage%'
  --and product_location in ($Regions) -- future use
  --AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts) --future use
  --AND $CurTable .line_item_product_code in ($Services) --future use
GROUP BY 1

-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena 
SELECT
  date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
  SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as cost
from $CurTable
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_operation = 'RunInstances'
  AND line_item_usage_type Like '%Usage%'
  --AND product_location in ($Regions) --future use
  --AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts) --future use
  --AND $CurTable .line_item_product_code in ($Services) -- future use
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 1

panels.description: Status failure Metrics for the entire ASG. This metric reports whether the instance has passed both the instance status check and the system status check in the last minute. This metric can be either 0 (passed) or 1 (failed). By default, this metric is available at a 1-minute frequency at no charge.

targets.rawSQL:
-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena
-- To view resource names add in line_item_resource_id to the SELECT and GROUP BY statements
SELECT
  date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
  SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as cost
from $CurTable
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_operation = 'RunInstances'
  AND line_item_usage_type Like '%Usage%'
  --AND product_location in ($Regions)
  --AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts)
  --AND $CurTable .line_item_product_code in ($Services)
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Instance Status Check Failed - ASG: $ASGName

panels.description: The number of earned CPU credits (T instances) that an instance(s) have accrued since they were launched or started for the named Auto Scaling Group. Credits are accrued in the credit balance after they are earned, and removed from the credit balance when they are spent. The credit balance has a maximum limit, determined by the instance size.

targets.rawSQL:
-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena
-- To view resource names add in line_item_resource_id to the SELECT and GROUP BY statements
SELECT
  date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
  SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as cost
from $CurTable
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_operation = 'RunInstances'
  AND line_item_usage_type Like '%Usage%'
  --AND product_location in ($Regions) --future use
  --AND line_item_usage_account_id IN ($LinkedAccounts) -- future use
  --AND $CurTable .line_item_product_code in ($Services) -- future use
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: CPU Credit Balance - ASG: $ASGName

targets.rawSQL:

SELECT 
  date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
  SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as cost
FROM
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date)

  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  -- AND line_item_operation = 'RunInstances'
  AND line_item_usage_type LIKE '%AWS%Bytes%'
GROUP BY 
1
HAVING SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) > 0

panels.description: Load Balancer LCU Usage for $LBName - Be sure to update the Load Balancer Name variable at the top of the dashboard.

targets.rawSQL:
-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena
-- To view resource names add in line_item_resource_id to the SELECT and GROUP BY statements
SELECT
date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date) 
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AWSELB'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND (line_item_usage_type = 'LCUUsage' OR line_item_usage_type = 'NLCUUsage')
  AND line_item_operation LIKE '%LoadBalancing%'
  AND line_item_resource_id LIKE CONCAT('%', '$LBName')
  GROUP BY
  1
  HAVING SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) > 0

panels.title: LCU Metrics  - ELB: $LBName

panels.description: Load Balancer LCU Usage for ELB $LBName - Be sure to update the Load Balancer Name variable at the top of the dashboard.

targets.rawSQL:
-- When troubleshooting a query, it helps to use the Query Inspector button and copy the query into Athena
-- To view resource names add in line_item_resource_id to the SELECT and GROUP BY statements
SELECT
date_trunc('$Granularity', line_item_usage_start_date),
SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) as cost
FROM 
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(line_item_usage_start_date) 
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AWSELB'
  AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
  AND line_item_usage_type = 'LoadBalancerUsage' 
  AND line_item_operation LIKE '%LoadBalancing%'
  AND line_item_resource_id LIKE CONCAT('%', '$LBName')
  GROUP BY
  1
  HAVING SUM(line_item_unblended_cost) > 0

  AND line_item_operation = 'NatGateway'
  AND line_item_resource_id LIKE CONCAT('%', '$NGWName')
  GROUP BY
  1

options.content:
ASG Name: $ASGName
Tag Key: $TagKey
Tag Value: $TagValue

Scaling Activity- Graphs Cloudwatch GroupDesiredCapacity and GroupTotalInstances over the total instance compute cost for instances tagged with $TagKey:$TagValue.
Average CPU- Graphs Cloudwatch Total ASG CPUUtilization over the total instance compute cost for instances tagged with $TagKey:$TagValue.
Instance Status Check Failed- Graphs Cloudwatch Total ASG CPUUtilization over the total instance compute cost for instances tagged with $TagKey:$TagValue. See Instance Status Checks
CPU Credit Balance- Graphs Cloudwatch CPUCreditUsage and CPUCreditBalance for the ASG over the total instance compute cost for instances tagged with $TagKey:$TagValue.
See Burstable CPU Credits.
The link at the top of each graph will open up Cloudwatch metrics for each scenario.

ASG Name: $ASGName
Tag Key: $TagKey
Tag Value: $TagValue

Scaling Activity- Graphs Cloudwatch NetworkOut for the ASG over the total cost of networking for all resources tagged with $TagKey:$TagValue.
Average CPU- Graphs Cloudwatch NetworkPacketsOut for the ASG over the total cost of networking for all resources tagged with $TagKey:$TagValue.

The link at the top of each graph will open up Cloudwatch metrics for each scenario.

list.description: Input the name of your autoscaling group
list.label: ASG Name
list.name: ASGName

list.description: Load Balancer Name - tagged with $TagKey $TagValue - Look back period of 3 Days.
list.label: Load Balancer
list.name: LBName

query.rawSQL:
SELECT 
  DISTINCT(line_item_resource_id)
FROM
  $CurTable
WHERE 
  line_item_usage_start_date >= (current_date - interval '3' day) --lookback period
  AND line_item_product_code = 'AWSELB'
  AND resource_tags_user_project IN ($TagValue)

list.description: Select the Nat Gateways for this workload tagged with $TagKey $TagValue - Look back period of 3 Days
list.label: NatGatway
list.name: NGWName

query.rawSQL:
SELECT 
DISTINCT line_item_resource_id
FROM
$CurTable
WHERE 
line_item_usage_start_date >= (current_date - interval '3' day) --lookback period
AND line_item_product_code = 'AmazonEC2'
AND resource_tags_user_$TagKey IN ($TagValue)
AND line_item_usage_type LIKE 'NatGateway-%'
AND line_item_operation = 'NatGateway'
